intro: Schkuhria anthemoidea, commonly known as the yellow sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a low-growing perennial that typically forms dense mats of foliage, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, adding a delicate touch of color to its habitat. Its leaves are typically linear and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in dry conditions. Schkuhria anthemoidea is well adapted to harsh environments, making it an important component of desert ecosystems.
